message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the concept of mixtures. A mixture is a combination of two or more substances that are not chemically bonded together. Option (A) is an example of a mixture because a gin and tonic martini is made by mixing gin and tonic water together. Option (B) is incorrect because it is a combination of a plant and soil, which can be considered more of a symbiotic relationship rather than a mixture. Option (C) is incorrect because it is a combination of different types of rocks (pebbles) and sand, which can be considered more of a heterogeneous mixture. Option (D) is incorrect because it is a leaf that fell into water, which can be considered more of an impurity or contaminant rather than a mixture.

This question requires knowledge about mixtures and their properties. Option (A) is the correct answer because a gin and tonic martini is a mixture of gin, tonic, and possibly other ingredients. A mixture is a combination of two or more substances that are not chemically combined and can be physically separated. Options (B), (C), and (D) all involve substances that are not mixed together but rather coexist in the same space. A plant potted in soil involves a plant and soil, which are separate components. Pebbles on a sandy beach are not mixed together, but rather exist side by side. A leaf that fell in water is not chemically combined with the water, but rather coexists in the same body of water.

This question requires knowledge about the different types of substances and mixtures. A mixture is a combination of two or more substances that are not chemically bonded together. Option (A) is a mixture because a gin and tonic martini consists of gin and tonic water mixed together. Option (B) is not a mixture because a plant potted in soil is a combination of a living organism (the plant) and a substrate (the soil) that is necessary for its growth. Option (C) is not a mixture because pebbles and sand are two separate substances found together in their natural environment. Option (D) is not a mixture because the leaf that fell in water is a physical contact between two substances, but they are not mixed together in a homogeneous manner.

This question requires knowledge of what constitutes a mixture. A mixture is a combination of two or more substances that are physically combined. Option (A), a gin and tonic martini, is an example of a mixture because it is made by combining gin and tonic together. Option (B), a plant potted in soil, is incorrect because it is a combination of two substances (plant and soil) but they are not physically combined, as the soil acts as a medium for the plant to grow in. Option (C), pebbles on a sandy beach, is also incorrect because it is a combination of different substances (pebbles and sand) but they are not physically combined and can be easily separated. Option (D), a leaf that fell in water, is incorrect because it is a suspension, not a mixture. The leaf is not dissolved in the water, but rather remains intact and can be easily separated from the water.

This question requires understanding of what constitutes a mixture. A mixture is a combination of two or more substances that are physically combined and can be separated easily. Option (A) is a mixture because a gin and tonic martini is made by combining gin and tonic water, which can be easily separated. Option (B) is not a mixture because a plant potted in soil is a combination of two substances that cannot be easily separated. Option (C) is not a mixture because pebbles on a sandy beach are not combined together, they are simply present in the same location. Option (D) is not a mixture because a leaf that fell in water does not involve the combination of two or more substances.

This question requires some basic understanding of mixtures. A mixture is a substance made up of two or more components that are physically combined and can be separated. Option (A) is the correct answer because a gin and tonic martini is a mixture of gin and tonic water. Option (B) is incorrect because a plant potted in soil is an example of a solution, where the components are evenly distributed and not easily separated. Option (C) is incorrect because pebbles on a sandy beach are not combined in a way that they can be easily separated. Option (D) is incorrect because a leaf that fell in water is not a mixture, but rather a physical change where the leaf becomes wet.

To determine the correct answer, we must understand what a mixture is. A mixture is a combination of two or more substances that are not chemically combined. In this case, option (A) is the correct answer because a gin and tonic martini is a combination of gin and tonic, which are two different substances mixed together. 

Option (B) is incorrect because a plant potted in soil is an example of a solution, where the soil acts as the medium in which the plant grows. It is not a mixture in the sense that the substances are mixed together but rather the plant is growing in the soil.

Option (C) may seem like a possible answer, but it is incorrect because while pebbles and sand are present on a sandy beach, they are not mixed together in the same way that gin and tonic are mixed together in a martini.

Option (D) is also incorrect because a leaf that fell in water is an example of a suspension, where the leaf is temporarily mixed with the water but will eventually settle at the bottom. It is not a mixture in the same sense as the gin and tonic martini.
